body:
Hey @phyro 

I know you've cited this before ([here](https://github.com/ethereumclassic/ECIPs/pull/232#issuecomment-560489730), [here](https://github.com/ethereumclassic/ECIPs/pull/231#issuecomment-560489250)), and definitely get and agree with the motivation. I'm just looking for the documentation for the "if there's agreement to do that in a call" (which I'm assuming by which you mean "rough consensus" or establishing "general agreement") necessary procedure you're mentioning. 

> We can only move it to Last Call if there's agreement to do that in a call we should have as a community.
> https://github.com/ethereumclassic/ECIPs/pull/232#issuecomment-560489730

> We can only Reject it after we collectively agree in a call to do so.
> https://github.com/ethereumclassic/ECIPs/pull/230#issuecomment-560488958

>  If it is Rejected, that should be after a call between participants agreeing to Reject it. 
> https://github.com/ethereumclassic/ECIPs/pull/229#issuecomment-560488629

> [ditto above]
>  https://github.com/ethereumclassic/ECIPs/pull/231#issuecomment-560489250

Can't seem to find the supportive procedural specification for these calls.

I've found: 

> - Rejected - Reasons for rejecting ECIPs include duplication of effort, disregard for formatting rules, unfocused or too broad, being technically unsound, not providing proper motivation, or obvious popular disapproval.
> https://github.com/ethereumclassic/ECIPs#ecip-status-terms

and the following diagram from https://github.com/ethereumclassic/ECIPs#process-overview:

![Screenshot_20191203_102004](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45600330/70063861-7f2b5980-15b6-11ea-9747-9585b9f74c2c.png)

Rel #237 for wanting citation for `Last Call` follow-the-rules specification.
